Description: Fragment of Attic red-figured small pottery closed vase with drops of glaze on the interior. Head and shoulders of a youth facing left in the foreground, his right arm around his head; left arm stretched out, the forearm behind a circular object; in the background, drapery, perhaps of a female in the background.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The iconography is puzzling. The youth seems to be at a lower level, though not enough is preserved to judge whether this is a multi-level composition.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 106 no. 373 pl. 79)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1932)
